20110113010007.000|20110113010009.000|TR0|BLITZER:   John King is in Tucson.  He's 
20110113010009.000|20110113010011.000|TR0|been there since this crisis erupted.  
20110113010011.000|20110113010013.000|TR0|You've had a chance, John, to speak with a 
20110113010013.000|20110113010016.000|TR0|lot of people there, average people and 
20110113010016.000|20110113010018.000|TR0|leaders, political leaders.  Is there a 
20110113010018.000|20110113010020.000|TR0|healing process already under way or is it 
20110113010020.000|20110113010023.000|TR0|premature?
20110113010023.000|20110113010025.000|TR0|
20110113010025.000|20110113010027.000|TR0|KING:  There is a healing process under 
20110113010027.000|20110113010030.000|TR0|way.  There's also a great sense of shock. 
20110113010030.000|20110113010032.000|TR0| One of the people I spoke to today was an 
20110113010032.000|20110113010034.000|TR0|aid to Congresswoman Giffords.  She was 
20110113010034.000|20110113010037.000|TR0|standing three feet away, snapping 
20110113010037.000|20110113010039.000|TR0|photographs when she said she noticed 
20110113010039.000|20110113010041.000|TR0|somebody walk up next to her silently.  
20110113010041.000|20110113010044.000|TR0|Then she saw the arm come up and the 
20110113010044.000|20110113010046.000|TR0|shooter open fire.
20110113010046.000|20110113010048.000|TR0|

20110113010051.000|20110113010053.000|TR0|memorial service tonight because her

20110113010055.000|20110113010057.000|TR0|among those who was gunned down and

20110113011051.000|20110113011053.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED MALE:  To guide our community 
20110113011053.000|20110113011055.000|TR0|through this evening's event, please 
20110113011055.000|20110113011058.000|TR0|welcome Dr. Robert Shelton, president of 
20110113011058.000|20110113011100.000|TR0|the University of Arizona.
20110113011100.000|20110113011102.000|TR0|
20110113011102.000|20110113011105.000|TR0|ROBERT N. SHELTON, PRESIDENT, UNIVERSITY 
20110113011105.000|20110113011107.000|TR0|OF ARIZONA:  Good evening.  On behalf of 
20110113011107.000|20110113011109.000|TR0|the faculty, the staff, and students of 
20110113011109.000|20110113011112.000|TR0|the University of Arizona here in Tucson, 
20110113011112.000|20110113011114.000|TR0|Arizona, I am privileged to welcome you to 
20110113011114.000|20110113011116.000|TR0|"Together We Thrive, Tucson and America."
20110113011116.000|20110113011119.000|TR0|
20110113011119.000|20110113011121.000|TR0|Our thanks -- our thanks to Dr. Carlos 
20110113011121.000|20110113011123.000|TR0|Gonzales, a member of the Pascua Yaqui 
20110113011123.000|20110113011126.000|TR0|Nation, for offering tonight's blessing.
20110113011126.000|20110113011128.000|TR0|
20110113011128.000|20110113011130.000|TR0|We shall now be led in the national anthem 
20110113011130.000|20110113011132.000|TR0|by the Tucson Symphony Orchestra, 
20110113011132.000|20110113011135.000|TR0|conducted by George Hanson and sung by 
20110113011135.000|20110113011137.000|TR0|Dennis Tamblen, a doctoral student in 
20110113011137.000|20110113011139.000|TR0|music here at the University of Arizona.
20110113011139.000|20110113011142.000|TR0|
20110113011142.000|20110113011144.000|TR0|(MUSIC)     SHELTON:  Please be seated.
20110113011144.000|20110113011146.000|TR0|
20110113011146.000|20110113011149.000|TR0|Tonight, we have gathered here as a 
20110113011149.000|20110113011151.000|TR0|community to mourn a tragic and senseless 
20110113011151.000|20110113011153.000|TR0|loss.  We are here to try in a small way 
20110113011153.000|20110113011156.000|TR0|to bring comfort to those whose lives have 
20110113011156.000|20110113011158.000|TR0|been forever changed by an act so heinous 
20110113011158.000|20110113011200.000|TR0|that it is simply impossible to comprehend.
20110113011200.000|20110113011203.000|TR0|
20110113011203.000|20110113011205.000|TR0|No one who lives here was untouched by the 
20110113011205.000|20110113011207.000|TR0|events of last Saturday.  Over the past 
20110113011207.000|20110113011210.000|TR0|few days, I've repeatedly heard people 
20110113011210.000|20110113011212.000|TR0|ask, "How could such a thing have 
20110113011212.000|20110113011214.000|TR0|happened?"  And, "How could it have 
20110113011214.000|20110113011217.000|TR0|happened here, in our town, and to people 
20110113011217.000|20110113011219.000|TR0|so loved and so admired?"
20110113011219.000|20110113011221.000|TR0|
20110113011221.000|20110113011223.000|TR0|One of the characteristics that has always 
20110113011223.000|20110113011226.000|TR0|struck me about Tucson's uniqueness is how 
20110113011226.000|20110113011228.000|TR0|such a vast metropolitan area of more than 
20110113011228.000|20110113011230.000|TR0|one million people can function so much 
20110113011230.000|20110113011233.000|TR0|like a small college town.
20110113011233.000|20110113011235.000|TR0|
20110113011235.000|20110113011237.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113011237.000|20110113011240.000|TR0|
20110113011240.000|20110113011242.000|TR0|SHELTON:  It is in the truest and best 
20110113011242.000|20110113011244.000|TR0|sense of the word, a community.  Where 
20110113011244.000|20110113011247.000|TR0|people know each other and care about each 
20110113011247.000|20110113011249.000|TR0|other.
20110113011249.000|20110113011251.000|TR0|
20110113011251.000|20110113011254.000|TR0|The University of Arizona sits in the 
20110113011254.000|20110113011256.000|TR0|middle of that community, both literally 
20110113011256.000|20110113011258.000|TR0|and figuratively.  By hosting this 
20110113011258.000|20110113011301.000|TR0|ceremony, we hope that we can begin the 
20110113011301.000|20110113011303.000|TR0|process of healing.
20110113011303.000|20110113011305.000|TR0|
20110113011305.000|20110113011308.000|TR0|Tonight, we have a chance to pray for 
20110113011308.000|20110113011310.000|TR0|those who were wounded, to remember those 
20110113011310.000|20110113011312.000|TR0|who were lost, and to reaffirm, reaffirm 
20110113011312.000|20110113011314.000|TR0|our commitment to each other.
20110113011314.000|20110113011317.000|TR0|
20110113011317.000|20110113011319.000|TR0|Representative Gabrielle Giffords is a

20110113011324.000|20110113011326.000|TR0|
20110113011326.000|20110113011328.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)

20110113011331.000|20110113011333.000|TR0|SHELTON:  This attack on her and on her 
20110113011333.000|20110113011335.000|TR0|constituents, our neighbors, our friends, 
20110113011335.000|20110113011338.000|TR0|has changed us all.  The question we have 
20110113011338.000|20110113011340.000|TR0|to answer is whether that change will make 
20110113011340.000|20110113011342.000|TR0|us angry and afraid or whether it will 
20110113011342.000|20110113011345.000|TR0|inspire us to commit to building a more 
20110113011345.000|20110113011347.000|TR0|sensible and caring world.
20110113011347.000|20110113011349.000|TR0|

20110113011545.000|20110113011547.000|TR0|

20110113011552.000|20110113011554.000|TR0|were attending Congresswoman Gabby 
20110113011554.000|20110113011557.000|TR0|Giffords' event in order to participate in 
20110113011557.000|20110113011559.000|TR0|the Democratic process.
20110113011559.000|20110113011601.000|TR0|

20110113011606.000|20110113011608.000|TR0|her life serving.  Like many students at

20110113011620.000|20110113011622.000|TR0|service in its most genuine form.

20110113011625.000|20110113011627.000|TR0|From my experience, I believe that one of

20110113011629.000|20110113011631.000|TR0|away from Saturday is that we need to 
20110113011631.000|20110113011634.000|TR0|continue to be devoted public servants and 
20110113011634.000|20110113011636.000|TR0|citizens.  On Saturday --
20110113011636.000|20110113011638.000|TR0|

20110113011834.000|20110113011837.000|TR0|But I also want to start off with a few 
20110113011837.000|20110113011839.000|TR0|words.  The first of which is e pluribus 
20110113011839.000|20110113011841.000|TR0|unum. Never have those words ever been 
20110113011841.000|20110113011844.000|TR0|truer than they are today.  Out of many 
20110113011844.000|20110113011846.000|TR0|one.
20110113011846.000|20110113011848.000|TR0|
20110113011848.000|20110113011851.000|TR0|One thing that we have learned from this 
20110113011851.000|20110113011853.000|TR0|great tragedy is we come together.  On 
20110113011853.000|20110113011855.000|TR0|Saturday, we all became Tucsonians.  On 
20110113011855.000|20110113011857.000|TR0|Saturday, we have all became Arizonians.  
20110113011857.000|20110113011900.000|TR0|And above all, we all became Americans.
20110113011900.000|20110113011902.000|TR0|
20110113011902.000|20110113011904.000|TR0|Despite the horrific actions that were 
20110113011904.000|20110113011907.000|TR0|taken on Saturday where so many were lost, 
20110113011907.000|20110113011909.000|TR0|we saw glimmers of hope.  These glimmers 
20110113011909.000|20110113011911.000|TR0|of hope come from people who are the real 
20110113011911.000|20110113011914.000|TR0|heroes.  Although I appreciate the 
20110113011914.000|20110113011916.000|TR0|sentiment, I must humbly reject the use of 
20110113011916.000|20110113011918.000|TR0|the word hero because I am not one.
20110113011918.000|20110113011921.000|TR0|
20110113011921.000|20110113011923.000|TR0|The people who are the heroes are people 
20110113011923.000|20110113011925.000|TR0|like Pam Simon. Congresswoman Gabrielle 
20110113011925.000|20110113011928.000|TR0|Giffords.  Gabe Zimmerman who 
20110113011928.000|20110113011930.000|TR0|unfortunately we lost that day.  Ron 
20110113011930.000|20110113011932.000|TR0|Barber.  The first responders.  And also 
20110113011932.000|20110113011935.000|TR0|people like Dr. Rhee who have done an 
20110113011935.000|20110113011937.000|TR0|amazing job at making sure that Gabby is 
20110113011937.000|20110113011939.000|TR0|OK.  And those who were injured are being 
20110113011939.000|20110113011942.000|TR0|treated to the best of our ability.
20110113011942.000|20110113011944.000|TR0|
20110113011944.000|20110113011946.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113011946.000|20110113011948.000|TR0|
20110113011948.000|20110113011951.000|TR0|Thank you.
20110113011951.000|20110113011953.000|TR0|
20110113011953.000|20110113011955.000|TR0|We have all come together to realize that 
20110113011955.000|20110113011958.000|TR0|what defines us is not the differences.  
20110113011958.000|20110113012000.000|TR0|It is that we are all together.  We are 
20110113012000.000|20110113012002.000|TR0|all a family.  We are all Americans.  And 
20110113012002.000|20110113012005.000|TR0|we must recognize that the real heroes, 
20110113012005.000|20110113012007.000|TR0|like I mentioned, are the people who have 
20110113012007.000|20110113012009.000|TR0|dedicated their life to public service.  
20110113012009.000|20110113012012.000|TR0|Whether it's direct care in nursing.  Or 
20110113012012.000|20110113012014.000|TR0|being a physician.  Or being a great 
20110113012014.000|20110113012016.000|TR0|representative like Congresswoman 
20110113012016.000|20110113012019.000|TR0|Gabrielle Giffords.  Or being a staffer.
20110113012019.000|20110113012021.000|TR0|
20110113012021.000|20110113012023.000|TR0|They are the people who we should be 
20110113012023.000|20110113012026.000|TR0|honoring.  And they are the people that we 
20110113012026.000|20110113012028.000|TR0|need to keep in our thoughts and our 
20110113012028.000|20110113012030.000|TR0|prayers.  So I thank you for this 
20110113012030.000|20110113012032.000|TR0|opportunity but I say we must reject the 
20110113012032.000|20110113012035.000|TR0|title of hero and reserve it for those who 
20110113012035.000|20110113012037.000|TR0|deserve it, and those who deserve it are 
20110113012037.000|20110113012039.000|TR0|the public servants and the first 
20110113012039.000|20110113012042.000|TR0|responders and the people who have made 
20110113012042.000|20110113012044.000|TR0|sure that they have dedicated their life 
20110113012044.000|20110113012046.000|TR0|to taking care of others.
20110113012046.000|20110113012049.000|TR0|

20110113012212.000|20110113012214.000|TR0|Thank you.

20110113012219.000|20110113012221.000|TR0|
20110113012221.000|20110113012224.000|TR0|Mr. President, on behalf of the people of 
20110113012224.000|20110113012226.000|TR0|the state of Arizona, I thank you for

20110113012233.000|20110113012235.000|TR0|
20110113012235.000|20110113012238.000|TR0|In the aftermath of Saturday, your words 
20110113012238.000|20110113012240.000|TR0|have been a source of comfort and strength 
20110113012240.000|20110113012242.000|TR0|to every Arizonan.  Your presence today 
20110113012242.000|20110113012245.000|TR0|serves as a reminder that we are not alone 
20110113012245.000|20110113012247.000|TR0|in our sorrow.  America grieves with us.
20110113012247.000|20110113012249.000|TR0|

20110113012252.000|20110113012254.000|TR0|wounded heal, to join our neighbors and 
20110113012254.000|20110113012256.000|TR0|our state in mourning a loss beyond 
20110113012256.000|20110113012258.000|TR0|measure.  There is no way to measure what

20110113012301.000|20110113012303.000|TR0|Saturday.  A day that began as a warm 
20110113012303.000|20110113012305.000|TR0|Arizona morning.  Neighbors were grocery 
20110113012305.000|20110113012308.000|TR0|shopping, running errands.  They were

20110113012315.000|20110113012317.000|TR0|

20110113013313.000|20110113013315.000|TR0|whose streams make glad the city of God, 
20110113013315.000|20110113013317.000|TR0|the holy place where the most high dwells. 
20110113013317.000|20110113013320.000|TR0| God is within her, she will not fall; God 
20110113013320.000|20110113013322.000|TR0|will help her at break of day."

20110113014236.000|20110113014238.000|TR0| They remind us that heroism does not 
20110113014238.000|20110113014240.000|TR0|require special training or physical 
20110113014240.000|20110113014243.000|TR0|strength.  Heroism is here, in the hearts

20110113014250.000|20110113014252.000|TR0|
20110113014252.000|20110113014254.000|TR0|Their actions, their selflessness poses a 
20110113014254.000|20110113014257.000|TR0|challenge to each of us.  It raises the 
20110113014257.000|20110113014259.000|TR0|question of what, beyond prayers and 
20110113014259.000|20110113014301.000|TR0|expressions of concern, is required of us 
20110113014301.000|20110113014304.000|TR0|going forward.  How can we honor the 
20110113014304.000|20110113014306.000|TR0|fallen?  How can we be true to their 
20110113014306.000|20110113014308.000|TR0|memory?
20110113014308.000|20110113014311.000|TR0|
20110113014311.000|20110113014313.000|TR0|You see, when a tragedy like this strikes, 
20110113014313.000|20110113014315.000|TR0|it is part of our nature to demand 
20110113014315.000|20110113014318.000|TR0|explanations, to try to impose some order 
20110113014318.000|20110113014320.000|TR0|on the chaos and make sense out of that 
20110113014320.000|20110113014322.000|TR0|which seems senseless.
20110113014322.000|20110113014324.000|TR0|
20110113014324.000|20110113014327.000|TR0|Already, we've seen a national 
20110113014327.000|20110113014329.000|TR0|conversation commence, not only about the 
20110113014329.000|20110113014331.000|TR0|motivations behind these killings, but 
20110113014331.000|20110113014334.000|TR0|about everything from the merits of gun 
20110113014334.000|20110113014336.000|TR0|safety laws to the adequacy of our mental 
20110113014336.000|20110113014338.000|TR0|health system.  And much -- much of this 
20110113014338.000|20110113014341.000|TR0|process...
20110113014341.000|20110113014343.000|TR0|

20110113014345.000|20110113014348.000|TR0|
20110113014348.000|20110113014350.000|TR0|... of debating what might be done to 
20110113014350.000|20110113014352.000|TR0|prevent such tragedies in the future is an 
20110113014352.000|20110113014355.000|TR0|essential ingredient in our exercise of 
20110113014355.000|20110113014357.000|TR0|self- government.
20110113014357.000|20110113014359.000|TR0|
20110113014359.000|20110113014402.000|TR0|But at a time when our discourse has 
20110113014402.000|20110113014404.000|TR0|become so sharply polarized, at a time 
20110113014404.000|20110113014406.000|TR0|when we are far too eager to lay the blame 
20110113014406.000|20110113014409.000|TR0|for all that ails the world at the feet of 
20110113014409.000|20110113014411.000|TR0|those who happen to think differently than 
20110113014411.000|20110113014413.000|TR0|we do, it's important for us to pause for 
20110113014413.000|20110113014415.000|TR0|a moment and make sure that we're talking 
20110113014415.000|20110113014418.000|TR0|with each other in a way that -- that 
20110113014418.000|20110113014420.000|TR0|heals, not in a way that wounds.
20110113014420.000|20110113014422.000|TR0|
20110113014422.000|20110113014425.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014425.000|20110113014427.000|TR0|
20110113014427.000|20110113014429.000|TR0|Scripture tells us that there is evil in 
20110113014429.000|20110113014432.000|TR0|the world and that terrible things happen 
20110113014432.000|20110113014434.000|TR0|for reasons that defy human understanding. 
20110113014434.000|20110113014436.000|TR0| In the words of Job, "When I looked for 
20110113014436.000|20110113014439.000|TR0|light, then came darkness."  Bad things 
20110113014439.000|20110113014441.000|TR0|happen, and we have to guard against 
20110113014441.000|20110113014443.000|TR0|simple explanations in the aftermath.
20110113014443.000|20110113014446.000|TR0|
20110113014446.000|20110113014448.000|TR0|For the truth is, none of us can know 
20110113014448.000|20110113014450.000|TR0|exactly what triggered this vicious 
20110113014450.000|20110113014453.000|TR0|attack.  None of us can know with any 
20110113014453.000|20110113014455.000|TR0|certainty what might have stopped these 
20110113014455.000|20110113014457.000|TR0|shots from being fired or what thoughts 
20110113014457.000|20110113014500.000|TR0|lurked in the inner recesses of a violent 
20110113014500.000|20110113014502.000|TR0|man's mind.
20110113014502.000|20110113014504.000|TR0|
20110113014504.000|20110113014506.000|TR0|Yes, we had to examine all the facts 
20110113014506.000|20110113014509.000|TR0|behind this tragedy.  We cannot and will 
20110113014509.000|20110113014511.000|TR0|not be passive in the face of such 
20110113014511.000|20110113014513.000|TR0|violence.  We should be willing to 
20110113014513.000|20110113014516.000|TR0|challenge old assumptions in order to 
20110113014516.000|20110113014518.000|TR0|lessen the prospects of such violence in 
20110113014518.000|20110113014520.000|TR0|the future.
20110113014520.000|20110113014523.000|TR0|
20110113014523.000|20110113014525.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014525.000|20110113014527.000|TR0|
20110113014527.000|20110113014530.000|TR0|But what we cannot do is use this tragedy 
20110113014530.000|20110113014532.000|TR0|as one more occasion to turn on each other.
20110113014532.000|20110113014534.000|TR0|
20110113014534.000|20110113014537.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014537.000|20110113014539.000|TR0|
20110113014539.000|20110113014541.000|TR0|That we cannot do.
20110113014541.000|20110113014544.000|TR0|
20110113014544.000|20110113014546.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014546.000|20110113014548.000|TR0|
20110113014548.000|20110113014550.000|TR0|That we cannot do.
20110113014550.000|20110113014553.000|TR0|
20110113014553.000|20110113014555.000|TR0|As we discuss these issues, let each of us 
20110113014555.000|20110113014557.000|TR0|do so with a good dose of humility.  
20110113014557.000|20110113014600.000|TR0|Rather than pointing fingers or assigning 
20110113014600.000|20110113014602.000|TR0|blame, let's use this occasion to expand 
20110113014602.000|20110113014604.000|TR0|our moral imaginations, to listen to each 
20110113014604.000|20110113014607.000|TR0|other more carefully, to sharpen our 
20110113014607.000|20110113014609.000|TR0|instincts for empathy, and remind 
20110113014609.000|20110113014611.000|TR0|ourselves of all the ways that our hopes 
20110113014611.000|20110113014614.000|TR0|and dreams are bound together.  After 
20110113014614.000|20110113014616.000|TR0|all...
20110113014616.000|20110113014618.000|TR0|
20110113014618.000|20110113014621.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014621.000|20110113014623.000|TR0|
20110113014623.000|20110113014625.000|TR0|After all, that's what most of us do when 
20110113014625.000|20110113014628.000|TR0|we lose somebody in our family, especially 
20110113014628.000|20110113014630.000|TR0|if the loss is unexpected.  We're shaken 
20110113014630.000|20110113014632.000|TR0|out of our routines.  We're forced to look 
20110113014632.000|20110113014635.000|TR0|inward.  We reflect on the past.
20110113014635.000|20110113014637.000|TR0|
20110113014637.000|20110113014639.000|TR0|Did we spend enough time with an aging -- 
20110113014639.000|20110113014641.000|TR0|an aging parent, we wonder?  Did we 
20110113014641.000|20110113014644.000|TR0|express our gratitude for all the 
20110113014644.000|20110113014646.000|TR0|sacrifices that they made for us?  Did we 
20110113014646.000|20110113014648.000|TR0|tell a spouse just how desperately we 
20110113014648.000|20110113014651.000|TR0|loved them, not just once in a while, but 
20110113014651.000|20110113014653.000|TR0|every single day?
20110113014653.000|20110113014655.000|TR0|
20110113014655.000|20110113014658.000|TR0|So sudden loss causes us to look backward, 
20110113014658.000|20110113014700.000|TR0|but it also forces us to look forward, to 
20110113014700.000|20110113014702.000|TR0|reflect on the present and the future, on 
20110113014702.000|20110113014705.000|TR0|the manner in which we live our lives and 
20110113014705.000|20110113014707.000|TR0|nurture our relationships with those who 
20110113014707.000|20110113014709.000|TR0|are still with us.
20110113014709.000|20110113014712.000|TR0|
20110113014712.000|20110113014714.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)     We may ask ourselves if 
20110113014714.000|20110113014716.000|TR0|we've shown enough kindness and generosity 
20110113014716.000|20110113014719.000|TR0|and compassion to the people in our lives. 
20110113014719.000|20110113014721.000|TR0| Perhaps we question whether we're doing 
20110113014721.000|20110113014723.000|TR0|right by our children, or our community, 
20110113014723.000|20110113014726.000|TR0|whether our priorities are in order.  We 
20110113014726.000|20110113014728.000|TR0|recognize our own mortality. And we are 
20110113014728.000|20110113014730.000|TR0|reminded that, in the fleeting time we 
20110113014730.000|20110113014732.000|TR0|have on this Earth, what matters is not 
20110113014732.000|20110113014735.000|TR0|wealth, or status, or power, or fame, but 
20110113014735.000|20110113014737.000|TR0|rather how well we have loved and what 
20110113014737.000|20110113014739.000|TR0|small part we have played in making the 
20110113014739.000|20110113014742.000|TR0|lives of other people better.
20110113014742.000|20110113014744.000|TR0|
20110113014744.000|20110113014746.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014746.000|20110113014749.000|TR0|
20110113014749.000|20110113014751.000|TR0|And that process -- that process of 
20110113014751.000|20110113014753.000|TR0|reflection, of making sure we align our 
20110113014753.000|20110113014756.000|TR0|values with our actions, that, I believe, 
20110113014756.000|20110113014758.000|TR0|is what a tragedy like this requires.
20110113014758.000|20110113014800.000|TR0|
20110113014800.000|20110113014803.000|TR0|For those who were harmed, those who were 
20110113014803.000|20110113014805.000|TR0|killed, they are part of our family, an 
20110113014805.000|20110113014807.000|TR0|American family, 300 million strong. 
20110113014807.000|20110113014810.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014810.000|20110113014812.000|TR0|
20110113014812.000|20110113014814.000|TR0|We may not have known them personally, but 
20110113014814.000|20110113014817.000|TR0|surely we see ourselves in them.  In 
20110113014817.000|20110113014819.000|TR0|George and Dot, in Dorwin and Mavy, we 
20110113014819.000|20110113014821.000|TR0|sense the abiding love we have for our own 
20110113014821.000|20110113014823.000|TR0|husbands, our own wives, our own life 
20110113014823.000|20110113014826.000|TR0|partners.
20110113014826.000|20110113014828.000|TR0|
20110113014828.000|20110113014830.000|TR0|Phyllis, she's our mom or our grandma, 
20110113014830.000|20110113014833.000|TR0|Gabe, our brother or son.
20110113014833.000|20110113014835.000|TR0|
20110113014835.000|20110113014837.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014837.000|20110113014840.000|TR0|
20110113014840.000|20110113014842.000|TR0|In Judge Roll, we recognize not only a man 
20110113014842.000|20110113014844.000|TR0|who prized his family and doing his job 
20110113014844.000|20110113014847.000|TR0|well, but also a man who embodied 
20110113014847.000|20110113014849.000|TR0|America's fidelity to the law.
20110113014849.000|20110113014851.000|TR0|
20110113014851.000|20110113014854.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014854.000|20110113014856.000|TR0|
20110113014856.000|20110113014858.000|TR0|And in Gabby -- in Gabby, we see a 
20110113014858.000|20110113014901.000|TR0|reflection of our public- spiritedness, 
20110113014901.000|20110113014903.000|TR0|that desire to participate in that 
20110113014903.000|20110113014905.000|TR0|sometimes frustrating, sometimes 
20110113014905.000|20110113014907.000|TR0|contentious, but always necessary and 
20110113014907.000|20110113014910.000|TR0|never- ending process to form a more 
20110113014910.000|20110113014912.000|TR0|perfect union.
20110113014912.000|20110113014914.000|TR0|
20110113014914.000|20110113014917.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014917.000|20110113014919.000|TR0|
20110113014919.000|20110113014921.000|TR0|And in Christina, in Christina, we see all 
20110113014921.000|20110113014924.000|TR0|of our children, so curious, so trusting, 
20110113014924.000|20110113014926.000|TR0|so energetic, so full of magic, so 
20110113014926.000|20110113014928.000|TR0|deserving of our love, and so deserving of 
20110113014928.000|20110113014931.000|TR0|our good example.
20110113014931.000|20110113014933.000|TR0|
20110113014933.000|20110113014935.000|TR0|If this tragedy prompts reflection and 
20110113014935.000|20110113014938.000|TR0|debate, as it should, let's make sure it's 
20110113014938.000|20110113014940.000|TR0|worthy of those we have lost.
20110113014940.000|20110113014942.000|TR0|
20110113014942.000|20110113014945.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113014945.000|20110113014947.000|TR0|
20110113014947.000|20110113014949.000|TR0|Let's make sure it's not on the usual 
20110113014949.000|20110113014952.000|TR0|plane of politics and point-scoring and 
20110113014952.000|20110113014954.000|TR0|pettiness that drifts away in the next 
20110113014954.000|20110113014956.000|TR0|news cycle.
20110113014956.000|20110113014958.000|TR0|
20110113014958.000|20110113015001.000|TR0|The loss of these wonderful people should 
20110113015001.000|20110113015003.000|TR0|make every one of us strive to be better, 
20110113015003.000|20110113015005.000|TR0|to be better in our private lives, to be 
20110113015005.000|20110113015008.000|TR0|better friends and neighbors and 
20110113015008.000|20110113015010.000|TR0|co-workers and parents.       And if, as 
20110113015010.000|20110113015012.000|TR0|has been discussed in recent days, their 
20110113015012.000|20110113015015.000|TR0|death helps usher in more civility in our 
20110113015015.000|20110113015017.000|TR0|public discourse, let us remember it is 
20110113015017.000|20110113015019.000|TR0|not because a simple lack of civility 
20110113015019.000|20110113015022.000|TR0|caused this tragedy -- it did not -- but 
20110113015022.000|20110113015024.000|TR0|rather because only a more civil and 
20110113015024.000|20110113015026.000|TR0|honest public discourse can help us face 
20110113015026.000|20110113015029.000|TR0|up to the challenges of our nation in a 
20110113015029.000|20110113015031.000|TR0|way that would make them proud.
20110113015031.000|20110113015033.000|TR0|
20110113015033.000|20110113015036.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015036.000|20110113015038.000|TR0|
20110113015038.000|20110113015040.000|TR0|We should be civil because we want to live 
20110113015040.000|20110113015043.000|TR0|up to the example of public servants like 
20110113015043.000|20110113015045.000|TR0|John Roll and Gabby Giffords, who knew 
20110113015045.000|20110113015047.000|TR0|first and foremost that we are all 
20110113015047.000|20110113015049.000|TR0|Americans, and that we can question each 
20110113015049.000|20110113015052.000|TR0|other's ideas without questioning each 
20110113015052.000|20110113015054.000|TR0|other's love of country, and that our 
20110113015054.000|20110113015056.000|TR0|task, working together, is to constantly 
20110113015056.000|20110113015059.000|TR0|widen the circle of our concern so that we 
20110113015059.000|20110113015101.000|TR0|bequeath the American dream to future 
20110113015101.000|20110113015103.000|TR0|generations.
20110113015103.000|20110113015106.000|TR0|
20110113015106.000|20110113015108.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015108.000|20110113015110.000|TR0|
20110113015110.000|20110113015113.000|TR0|They believe -- they believe and I believe 
20110113015113.000|20110113015115.000|TR0|that we can be better. Those who died 
20110113015115.000|20110113015117.000|TR0|here, those who saved lives here, they 
20110113015117.000|20110113015120.000|TR0|help me believe. We may not be able to 
20110113015120.000|20110113015122.000|TR0|stop all evil in the world, but I know 
20110113015122.000|20110113015124.000|TR0|that how we treat one another, that's 
20110113015124.000|20110113015127.000|TR0|entirely up to us.
20110113015127.000|20110113015129.000|TR0|
20110113015129.000|20110113015131.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015131.000|20110113015133.000|TR0|
20110113015133.000|20110113015136.000|TR0|And I believe that, for all our 
20110113015136.000|20110113015138.000|TR0|imperfections, we are full of decency and 
20110113015138.000|20110113015140.000|TR0|goodness and that the forces that divide 
20110113015140.000|20110113015143.000|TR0|us are not as strong as those that unite 
20110113015143.000|20110113015145.000|TR0|us.
20110113015145.000|20110113015147.000|TR0|
20110113015147.000|20110113015150.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015150.000|20110113015152.000|TR0|

20110113015154.000|20110113015157.000|TR0|that's what a child like Christina-Taylor

20110113015159.000|20110113015201.000|TR0|
20110113015201.000|20110113015204.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015204.000|20110113015206.000|TR0|
20110113015206.000|20110113015208.000|TR0|Imagine -- can you imagine for a moment, 
20110113015208.000|20110113015211.000|TR0|here was a young girl who was just 
20110113015211.000|20110113015213.000|TR0|becoming aware of our democracy, just 
20110113015213.000|20110113015215.000|TR0|beginning to understand the obligations of 
20110113015215.000|20110113015218.000|TR0|citizenship, just starting to glimpse the 
20110113015218.000|20110113015220.000|TR0|fact that someday she, too, might play a 
20110113015220.000|20110113015222.000|TR0|part in shaping her nation's future.
20110113015222.000|20110113015224.000|TR0|
20110113015224.000|20110113015227.000|TR0|She had been elected to her student 
20110113015227.000|20110113015229.000|TR0|council.  She saw public service as 
20110113015229.000|20110113015231.000|TR0|something exciting and hopeful.  She was 
20110113015231.000|20110113015234.000|TR0|off to meet her congresswoman, someone she 
20110113015234.000|20110113015236.000|TR0|was sure was good and important and might 
20110113015236.000|20110113015238.000|TR0|be a role model.  She saw all this through 
20110113015238.000|20110113015241.000|TR0|the eyes of a child, undimmed by the 
20110113015241.000|20110113015243.000|TR0|cynicism or vitriol that we adults all too 
20110113015243.000|20110113015245.000|TR0|often just take for granted.
20110113015245.000|20110113015248.000|TR0|
20110113015248.000|20110113015250.000|TR0|I want us to live up to her expectations.
20110113015250.000|20110113015252.000|TR0|
20110113015252.000|20110113015255.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015255.000|20110113015257.000|TR0|
20110113015257.000|20110113015259.000|TR0|I want our democracy to be as good as 
20110113015259.000|20110113015302.000|TR0|Christina imagined it.  I want America to 
20110113015302.000|20110113015304.000|TR0|be as good as she imagined it.  All of us, 
20110113015304.000|20110113015306.000|TR0|we should do everything we can to make 
20110113015306.000|20110113015309.000|TR0|sure this country lives up to our

20110113015315.000|20110113015318.000|TR0|
20110113015318.000|20110113015320.000|TR0|As has already been mentioned, Christina 
20110113015320.000|20110113015322.000|TR0|was given to us on September 11th, 2001, 
20110113015322.000|20110113015325.000|TR0|one of 50 babies born that day to be 
20110113015325.000|20110113015327.000|TR0|pictured in a book called "Faces of Hope." 
20110113015327.000|20110113015329.000|TR0| On either side of her photo in that book 
20110113015329.000|20110113015332.000|TR0|were simple wishes for a child's life:  "I 
20110113015332.000|20110113015334.000|TR0|hope you help those in need," read one.  
20110113015334.000|20110113015336.000|TR0|"I hope you know all of the words to the 
20110113015336.000|20110113015339.000|TR0|National Anthem and sing it with your hand 
20110113015339.000|20110113015341.000|TR0|over your heart.  I hope -- I hope you 
20110113015341.000|20110113015343.000|TR0|jump in rain puddles."
20110113015343.000|20110113015346.000|TR0|
20110113015346.000|20110113015348.000|TR0|If there are rain puddles in Heaven, 
20110113015348.000|20110113015350.000|TR0|Christina is jumping in them today.
20110113015350.000|20110113015353.000|TR0|
20110113015353.000|20110113015355.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)

20110113015357.000|20110113015400.000|TR0|And here on this Earth, here on this 
20110113015400.000|20110113015402.000|TR0|Earth, we place our hands over our hearts 
20110113015402.000|20110113015404.000|TR0|and we commit ourselves as Americans to 
20110113015404.000|20110113015406.000|TR0|forging a country that is forever worthy 
20110113015406.000|20110113015409.000|TR0|of her gentle, happy spirit.
20110113015409.000|20110113015411.000|TR0|
20110113015411.000|20110113015413.000|TR0|May God bless and keep those we've lost in

20110113015416.000|20110113015418.000|TR0|and watch over the survivors.  And may he 
20110113015418.000|20110113015420.000|TR0|bless the United States of America.
20110113015420.000|20110113015423.000|TR0|

20110113015427.000|20110113015430.000|TR0|SHELTON:  Thank you.  Thank you, President 
20110113015430.000|20110113015432.000|TR0|Obama, for your remarkable, inspiring 
20110113015432.000|20110113015434.000|TR0|words.
20110113015434.000|20110113015437.000|TR0|
20110113015437.000|20110113015439.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015439.000|20110113015441.000|TR0|
20110113015441.000|20110113015444.000|TR0|SHELTON:  I also thank all of the speakers 
20110113015444.000|20110113015446.000|TR0|here tonight, as well as all of the 
20110113015446.000|20110113015448.000|TR0|federal, state and local leaders who have 
20110113015448.000|20110113015450.000|TR0|come tonight to lend their support.  We 
20110113015450.000|20110113015453.000|TR0|have heard many, many inspirational 
20110113015453.000|20110113015455.000|TR0|thoughts from our distinguished guests.
20110113015455.000|20110113015457.000|TR0|
20110113015457.000|20110113015500.000|TR0|At this time, I invite everyone here at 
20110113015500.000|20110113015502.000|TR0|the McKale Center and those watching here 
20110113015502.000|20110113015504.000|TR0|in Tucson and, indeed, around the nation, 
20110113015504.000|20110113015507.000|TR0|to join together in a moment of silence, 
20110113015507.000|20110113015509.000|TR0|which will be followed by a musical 
20110113015509.000|20110113015511.000|TR0|selection.
20110113015511.000|20110113015514.000|TR0|
20110113015514.000|20110113015516.000|TR0|Join me, please, in a moment of silence.
20110113015516.000|20110113015518.000|TR0|
20110113015518.000|20110113015521.000|TR0|(MUSIC)
20110113015521.000|20110113015523.000|TR0|
20110113015523.000|20110113015525.000|TR0|(APPLAUSE)
20110113015525.000|20110113015528.000|TR0|
20110113015528.000|20110113015530.000|TR0|SHELTON:  I know conclude the program 
20110113015530.000|20110113015532.000|TR0|tonight by reading a poem that was written 
20110113015532.000|20110113015535.000|TR0|by W.S. Merwin who is the current poet 
20110113015535.000|20110113015537.000|TR0|laureate of the United States of America.  
20110113015537.000|20110113015539.000|TR0|Mister Merwin has a long history with the 
20110113015539.000|20110113015541.000|TR0|Poetry Center here at the University of 
20110113015541.000|20110113015544.000|TR0|Arizona.
20110113015544.000|20110113015546.000|TR0|
20110113015546.000|20110113015548.000|TR0|The poem is entitled, "To the New Year."
20110113015548.000|20110113015551.000|TR0|
20110113015551.000|20110113015553.000|TR0|"With what stillness at last you appear in 
20110113015553.000|20110113015555.000|TR0|the valley.  Your first sunlight reaching 
20110113015555.000|20110113015558.000|TR0|down to touch the tips of a few high 
20110113015558.000|20110113015600.000|TR0|leaves that do not stir.  As though they 
20110113015600.000|20110113015602.000|TR0|have not noticed and did not know you at 
20110113015602.000|20110113015605.000|TR0|all.
20110113015605.000|20110113015607.000|TR0|
20110113015607.000|20110113015609.000|TR0|"Then the voice of a dove calls from the 
20110113015609.000|20110113015612.000|TR0|far away in itself to hush of morning.  So 
20110113015612.000|20110113015614.000|TR0|this is the sound of you.  Here and now,
